page.title: 08The Church in Brent Knoll
page.content: The church in Brent Knoll village is known as St. Michael's. It was built in the 15 century but has a Norman doorway with a wide heavy door. Each of the pew ends have a different carving and 3 of the carvings make up a story. The story concerns an Abbot of Glastonbury. The floor of the church slopes upwards towards the chancel, because the church is built on the slopes of Brent Knoll. The font is about 600 years old. There is a large marble monument on the wall, dedicated to John Somerset, who died in 1663, and his family.It is coloured in red, blue, white and black.
